title: Data Representation

description.core_idea: All data in a computer is ultimately represented as binary bits grouped into bytes.
explanation: A bit is the smallest unit of data and can be either 0 or 1.
Data types like integers are represented using a fixed number of bytes.
The meaning of data depends on how those bytes are interpreted.
key_points: Bits are the fundamental units of data
Data types have fixed sizes in memory
Memory stores raw bits, not meanings

examples: An integer may occupy 4 bytes (32 bits) in memory.
The same sequence of bits can represent different values depending on interpretation.
common_misconceptions: All data types take the same amount of memory
